BioStat | R package
  • Functions

Normality tests by goups

Perform Shapiro-Wilk (default), Lilliefors (Kolmogorov-Smirnov), Anderson_darling and other tests of normality.

test_normality(x, data = NULL, test = "Shapiro-Wilk", method = NULL, ...,
  groups = NULL)

# S3 method for test_normality
print(x, ..., digits_p = 2, signif_stars = TRUE,
  digits_stat = 3, rm_zero = FALSE, show_col_method = FALSE)

# S3 method for test_normality
pander(x, caption = NA, ..., digits_p = 2,
  signif_stars = TRUE, digits_stat = 3, rm_zero = FALSE,
  show_col_method = FALSE)

Arguments

x

Either a formula, a numeric vector or a name of a column in data.

  • If x is a formula (e.g. variable ~ factor), left-hand side provides name of variable to be tested. In the right-hand side there are names of factor variables to be used to create subsets. If the left-hand side is empty ((e.g. ~ factor), right-hand side is treated as variable name to test.
data

(data rame|NULL) Either a data frame that contains the variables mentioned in x or NULL (if the variables are in the function's environment).
test

(string | function) Either a string (case insensitive, may be unambiguously abbreviated) with a name of nomality test or a function, which carries out the test. Possible names of tests:

  • "SW", "Shapiro-Wilk" � for Shapiro-Wilk test;

  • "Lilliefors" � for Kolmogorov-Smirnov test wtih Lilliefor's correction;

  • "AD", "Anderson-Darling" � for Anderson-Darling test;

  • "CVM", "CM", "Cramer-von Mises" � for Cramer-von Mises test;

  • "SF", "Shapiro-Francia" � for Shapiro-Francia test;

  • "Chi-squared","Pearsons" � for Pearson's chi-squared test of normality.
method

(string) p value adjustment method for multiple comparisons. For available methods check p.adjust.methods.
...

Parameters to be passed to the main function (defined/selected in test) that carries out a normality test.
digits_p

(numeric) Number of significant digits to round a p value to. No less than 2.

  • if digits_p = 2:

    1. values below 0.001 are printed as "<0.001";

    2. values between 0.001 and 0.01 as "<0.01";

    3. all other values are rounded to two decimal places.

  • if digits_p = 3, only formatting "<0.01" is skipped.
signif_stars

(logical) If TRUE, significance stars are pronted.
digits_stat

(integer) number of either decimal places or significant digits to round test statistic to.
rm_zero

(logical) Flag if leading zero before the point should be removed.
show_col_method

(logical) If FALSE column "method" is not printed.
caption

(string|NULL|NA) A caption for the table with results of a normality test. If NA � a default caption is printed (default). If NULL � no caption is printed.

Value

A data frame with normality test results for each group.

Details

By default, methods print.test_normality and pander.test_normality do not print column called "method".

See also

Package nortest

Examples

library(BioStat)
library(pander)
data(CO2)

test_normality(uptake ~ Treatment, data = CO2)
#> 
#>  The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test 
#> 
#>    Treatment statistic p.value    
#> 1 nonchilled     0.945    0.04 *  
#> 2    chilled     0.898   <0.01 ** 
#> 0 �***� 0.001 �**� 0.01 �*� 0.05 �.� 0.1 � � 1

rez <- test_normality(uptake ~ Type + Treatment,
                      data = CO2)
rez
#> 
#>  The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test 
#> 
#>          Type  Treatment statistic p.value    
#> 1      Quebec nonchilled     0.825   <0.01 ** 
#> 2      Quebec    chilled     0.853   <0.01 ** 
#> 3 Mississippi nonchilled     0.855   <0.01 ** 
#> 4 Mississippi    chilled     0.948    0.31    
#> 0 �***� 0.001 �**� 0.01 �*� 0.05 �.� 0.1 � � 1

rez2 <- test_normality(uptake ~ Type + Treatment,
                       data = CO2,
                       test = "chi-sq")
rez2
#> 
#>  The results of Pearson chi-square normality test 
#> 
#>          Type  Treatment statistic p.value    
#> 1      Quebec nonchilled      13.3   <0.01 ** 
#> 2      Quebec    chilled      13.3   <0.01 ** 
#> 3 Mississippi nonchilled        10    0.04 *  
#> 4 Mississippi    chilled      5.33    0.25    
#> 0 �***� 0.001 �**� 0.01 �*� 0.05 �.� 0.1 � � 1


class(rez2)
#> [1] "test_normality" "data.frame"    


# Print as a 'pandoc' table
pander(rez)
#> 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#>     Type       Treatment    statistic   p.value  
#> ------------- ------------ ----------- ----------
#>    Quebec      nonchilled     0.825     <0.01 ** 
#> 
#>    Quebec       chilled       0.853     <0.01 ** 
#> 
#>  Mississippi   nonchilled     0.855     <0.01 ** 
#> 
#>  Mississippi    chilled       0.948       0.31   
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> 
#> Table: The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test.
#> 


pander(rez, digits = 3)
#> 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#>     Type       Treatment    statistic   p.value  
#> ------------- ------------ ----------- ----------
#>    Quebec      nonchilled     0.825     <0.01 ** 
#> 
#>    Quebec       chilled       0.853     <0.01 ** 
#> 
#>  Mississippi   nonchilled     0.855     <0.01 ** 
#> 
#>  Mississippi    chilled       0.948       0.31   
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> 
#> Table: The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test.
#>
